Sentencas: Due to sluggish oxygen reduction reactions, development in the solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) field is stagnant.
Titulo: Synthesis of active electrocatalysts using glycine-nitrate chemistry

Sentencas: Two solutions, increasing the active surface or use of precious materials, can stimulate the oxygen reduction kinetics on electrodes.
Titulo: Synthesis of active electrocatalysts using glycine-nitrate chemistry

Sentencas: Thus, to gain both these benefits, the present article addressed the synthesis of high surface-area mixed oxide ionic-electronic conductor La0.6Sr0.4Co0.8Fe0.2O3-delta (LSCF) using chemistry of the propellant glycine-nitrate reaction.
Titulo: Synthesis of active electrocatalysts using glycine-nitrate chemistry

Sentencas: In this study, different fuel to oxidant ratios (psi), 2.0, 2.6, and 3.0 were used to control the exothermicity of reaction and powder properties.
Titulo: Synthesis of active electrocatalysts using glycine-nitrate chemistry

Sentencas: The maximum reaction temperature of 1337 K at psi = 3.0 resulted in coarsened powder.
Titulo: Synthesis of active electrocatalysts using glycine-nitrate chemistry

Sentencas: In contrast, comparatively less exothermicity of reaction at psi = 2.0 resulted in powder with substantial Brunauer-Emmett-Teller surface area of 10.97 m(2) g(-1), with maximum powder compaction achieved at sintering of 1273 K.
Titulo: Synthesis of active electrocatalysts using glycine-nitrate chemistry

Sentencas: With optimal direct current in-plane electrical conductivity of 341 S cm(-1), H-2-temperature-programmed reduction showed excellent catalytic activity for the sample obtained at psi = 2.0.
Titulo: Synthesis of active electrocatalysts using glycine-nitrate chemistry

Sentencas: The electrochemical performance comparisons of electrodes in two different cell geometries - with and without a gold catalytic current collecting layer (Au-CCCL) - revealed the least polarization and cell resistance in the cell with Au-CCCL.
Titulo: Synthesis of active electrocatalysts using glycine-nitrate chemistry

Sentencas: The electrode area specific resistance and cell conductivity using Au-CCCL were 0.097 Omega cm(-2) and 0.15 S cm(-1), respectively.
Titulo: Synthesis of active electrocatalysts using glycine-nitrate chemistry
